summary: LocalActivity in SDK 2.7 generates full activity events (ActivityTaskScheduled, ActivityTaskStarted, ActivityTaskCompleted) instead of a single MarkerRecorded event in workflow history, reverting to behavior like a normal activity.
userImpact: Users relying on local activities to produce minimal workflow history (only MarkerRecorded events) experience unexpected full activity scheduling events after upgrading to SDK 2.7+.
rootCause: Regression introduced in SDK 2.7 where local activity execution logic was changed to dispatch full activity events instead of inline marker recording.
workaround: Downgrade to SDK 2.6 where local activity produces only MarkerRecorded events.
resolutionDetails: The regression from 2.7 was addressed in a subsequent version, restoring local activity to correctly generate only MarkerRecorded events.
keyQuote: During local activity execution, there are three events in the workflow history (ActivityTaskScheduled, ActivityTaskStarted, ActivityTaskCompleted).
